text:
Max Kay (1936 – 5 June 2019) was a Scottish-born Australian entertainer and businessman. He started his career in Scotland and toured internationally as the manager of Andy Stewart. He lived in Perth, Western Australia from the 1960s onward. He performed as an entertainer in Perth. He also served as a councillor for the City of Perth. He received the Medal of the Order of Australia (OAM) in 2003 for services to entertainment.
Kay died of pneumonia caused by cancer on 5 June 2019, at the age of 82.
